intro: Pleurothallis serrifera, commonly known as the serrated pleurothallis, is a species of orchid native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It is a small, epiphytic plant that typically grows on trees in humid, shaded environments. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces delicate, greenish-white flowers with a subtle fragrance. It is noted for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions and requires well-draining, nutrient-rich substrates. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a popular choice among orchid enthusiasts and botanists alike.
